      function OptanonWrapper() {
        var user = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('userDetails')) || {};
        const id = user.id ? user.id : window['pendo'].get_visitor_id();
        const firstName = user.first_name;
        const lastName = user.last_name;
        let targetingCookieValue;
        let dnpValue;
        const dataLayer = window.dataLayer;
        const GroupsArr = dataLayer?.filter((item) => item.event === 'OneTrustGroupsUpdated');
        console.log(window.dataLayer);
        if (GroupsArr?.length > 1) {
          const previousCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 2]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          const updatedCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 1]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          let FunctionalCategoryChanged;
          let TargetingCategoryChanged;
          const previousCLC003Exist = previousCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') > -1;
          const updatedCLC003Exist = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') > -1;
          if (previousCLC003Exist && !updatedCLC003Exist) {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = true;
            dnpValue = true;
          } else if (!previousCLC003Exist && updatedCLC003Exist) {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = true;
            dnpValue = false;
          } else {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = false;
          }

          const previousCLC004Exist = previousCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') > -1;
          const updatedCLC004Exist = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') > -1;
          if (previousCLC004Exist && !updatedCLC004Exist) {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = true;
            targetingCookieValue = 'NO';
          } else if (!previousCLC004Exist && updatedCLC004Exist) {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = true;
            targetingCookieValue = 'YES';
          } else {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = false;
          }

          if (FunctionalCategoryChanged) {
            callDNP(id, dnpValue, user.session);
          } else if (updatedCLC003Exist) {
            console.log('0003 on');
            initializePendo();
          }
          if (TargetingCategoryChanged) {
            /* this timeout is added because Pendo allows only one API call per second per visitor */
            setTimeout(() => {
              updateCustomMetadataField(id, targetingCookieValue, user.session);
            }, 2000);
          }

        } else if (GroupsArr?.length === 1) {
          const updatedCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 1]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          dnpValue = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') === -1;
          targetingCookieValue = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') === -1 ? 'NO' : 'YES';
          createVisitorId(firstName, lastName, id, dnpValue, targetingCookieValue, user.session);
        }
      };

    function createVisitorId(firstName, lastName, visitorId, dnpValue, targetingCookieValue, sid) {
      console.log('pendo create visitor');
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/createVisistor', {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify([{
          visitorId,
          values: {
            firstname: firstName,
            lastname: lastName
          }
        }])
      });

      fetch(request)
        .then(async response => {
          if (response.status === 200) {
            callDNP(visitorId, dnpValue, sid);
            setTimeout(() => {
              updateCustomMetadataField(visitorId, targetingCookieValue, sid);
            }, 2000);
          }
        })
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }

    function callDNP(visitorId, dnpValue, sid) {
      const params = {
        'visitorId': visitorId,
        'dnpValue': dnpValue
      };
      console.log('pendo callDNP');
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/dnp', {
        method: 'PUT',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify(params)
      });

      fetch(request)
        .then(async response => {
          if (!dnpValue) {
            window['pendo'] && window['pendo'].startGuides();
            initializePendo();
          } else {
             window['pendo'] && window['pendo'].stopGuides();
          }
        })
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }

    function getHeader(sid) {
      const headers = new Headers();
      headers.append('Content-Type', 'application/json');
      headers.append('SID', sid);
      return headers;
    }

    function initializePendo() {
      console.log('pendo initialize');
      var user = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('userDetails')) || {};
      window.pendo.initialize({
        visitor: {
          id: user.id ? user.id : window['pendo'].get_visitor_id(),
          truid: user.truid,
          email: user.email,
          full_name: user.full_name,
          session: user.session,
          sp: user.sp,
          interface_language: user.lang,
          entitlements: user.entitlements
        },
        account: {
          id: user.customerId,
          name: user.name,
          environment: user.environment
        }
      });
    }

    function updateCustomMetadataField(visitorId, targetingCookieValue, sid) {
      console.log('pendo update Target');
      const params = {
        'targetingCookieValue': targetingCookieValue,
        'visitorId': visitorId,
      };
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/updateMetaData', {
        method: 'PUT',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify(params)
      });

      fetch(request)
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }</script><style>.section-with-left-nav header{display:flex;justify-content:center;margin:0 .9375rem}.section-with-left-nav header CQDs/P25 exhibited improved photocatalytic H-2 evolution under UV-Vis and visible light (lambda &gt; 450 nm) irradiation without loading any noble metal cocatalyst, compared to pure P25. _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-202-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-202-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0036-8075&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=SCIENCE" data-ta="Sidenav-202-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-202-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 346 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (6215) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1344-1347 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec202AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p><mark>Quantum</mark> spin Hall (QSH) effect materials feature edge states that are topologically protected from backscattering. However, the small band gap in materials that have been identified as QSH insulators limits applications. We use first-principles calculations to predict a class of large-gap QSH insulators in two-dimensional transition metal dichalcogenides with 1T' structure, namely, 1T'-MX2 with</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" Electrochemical results reveal that the electrocatalyst prepa</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2155-5435&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ACS CATALYSIS" data-ta="Sidenav-204-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-204-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 8 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (4) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.3602-3635 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec204AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The inexorable rise of carbon dioxide level in the atmosphere, already exceeding 400 ppm, highlights the need for reduction of CO2 emissions. Harvesting solar energy to drive reverse chemical reactions to fuel combustion offers a possible solution. The produced chemical fuels (e.g. hydrogen, methane, or methanol) are also a convenient means of energy storage, not available in photovoltaic cells</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-205-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-205-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1998-0124&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NANO RESEARCH" data-ta="Sidenav-205-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-205-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 10 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (5) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1673-1696 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec205AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>In this work, we demonstrated the successful construction of metal-free zero-dimensional/two-dimensional carbon nanodot (CND)-hybridized protonated g-C3N4 (pCN) (CND/pCN) heterojunction photocatalysts by means of electrostatic attraction. We experimentally found that CNDs with an average diameter of 4.4 nm were uniformly distributed on the surface of pCN using electron microscopy analysis. The </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2192-2640&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCED HEALTHCARE MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-206-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-206-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 8 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (13) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec206AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>As an emerging clinical modality for cancer treatment, photodynamic therapy (PDT) takes advantage of the cytotoxic activity of reactive oxygen species (ROS) that are generated by light irradiating photosensitizers (PSs) in the presence of oxygen (O-2). However, further advancements including tumor selectivity and ROS generation efficiency are still required. Substantial efforts are devoted to d</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-207-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-207-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1476-1122&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-207-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-207-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 13 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (8) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.796-801 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec207AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Solution processing is a promising route for the realization of low-cost, large-area, flexible and lightweight photovoltaic devices with short energy payback time and high specific power. However, solar cells based on solution-processed organic, inorganic and hybrid materials reported thus far generally suffer from poor air stability, require an inert-atmosphere processing environment or necess</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-208-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-208-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1998-0124&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NANO RESEARCH" data-ta="Sidenav-208-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-208-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 8 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (4) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1199-1209 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec208AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Graphitic carbon nitride nanosheets (g-C3N4 NSs) hybridized nitrogen doped titanium dioxide (N-TiO2) nanofibers (GCN/NT NFs) have been synthesized in situ via a simple electrospinning process combined with a modified heat-etching method. The prepared GCN/NT NFs were characterized by a variety of methods and their photocatalytic activities were evaluated by hydrogen (H-2) production from water s</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0378-7753&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF POWER SOURCES" data-ta="Sidenav-209-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-209-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 400 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.31-68 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec209AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Developing earth-abundant-electrocatalysts for oxygen evolution reaction is one of the promising ways to achieve efficient water-splitting for hydrogen production (a clean chemical fuel). This paper reviews the activity, stability and durability for oxygen evolution reaction in alkaline medium of different types of recently reported electrocatalysts such as Ni, Co, NiCo, Fe, Se, Mo, Cu, Mn, Zn,</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" Although Fe2O3 has been considered as a promising anode material for asymmetric supercapacitors, the specific capacitance of the Fe2O3-based anodes is still low and cannot match that of cathodes in the full cells. As a proof of concept, a unique method is developed for synthesizing Cu-3(BTC)(2)@TiO2 core-shell structures with macroporous semiconductor shells that allow</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2058-8437&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE REVIEWS MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-212-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-212-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 5 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (1) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.44-60 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec212AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Non-radiative recombination losses hinder the performance of perovskite solar cells, preventing them from reaching the Shockley-Queisser limit. This Review systematically analyses the origin and impact of non-radiative recombination losses and highlights notable advances in their characterization and mitigation.</p><p>Photovoltaic solar cells based on metal-halide perovskites have gained consid</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-213-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-213-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1748-3387&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE NANOTECHNOLOGY" data-ta="Sidenav-213-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-213-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 10 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (8) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.707-713 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec213AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The ability to detect light over a broad spectral range is central to practical optoelectronic applications and has been successfully demonstrated with photodetectors of two-dimensional layered crystals such as graphene and MoS2. However, polarization sensitivity within such a photodetector remains elusive. Here, we demonstrate a broadband photodetector using a layered black phosphorus transist</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" Previous studies on dilute magnetic semiconductors such as (Ga, Mn) As and (In, Mn) Sb have demonstrated large modulations o</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 5 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (8) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1421-1426 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec215AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The study of the photophysical properties of organic-metallic lead halide perovskites, which demonstrate excellent photovoltaic performance in devices with electron- and hole-accepting layers, helps to understand their charge photogeneration and recombination mechanism and unravels their potential for other optoelectronic applications. We report surprisingly high photoluminescence (PL) <mark>quantum</mark> </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - Expand abstract for this record215">Show more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1530-6984&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NANO LETTERS" data-ta="Sidenav-216-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-216-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 15 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (1) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.565-573 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec216AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Nanoscale surface engineering is playing important role in enhancing the performance of battery electrode. VO2 is one of high-capacity but less-stable materials and has been used mostly in the form of powders for Li-ion battery cathode with mediocre performance. In this work, we design a new type of binder-free cathode by bottom-up growth of biface VO2 arrays directly on a graphene network for </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1433-7851&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ANGEWANDTE CHEMIE-INTERNATIONAL EDITION" data-ta="Sidenav-217-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-217-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 56 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (41) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.12471-12475 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec217AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Lead-based perovskite nanocrystals (NCs) have outstanding optical properties and cheap synthesis conferring them a tremendous potential in the field of optoelectronic devices. However, two critical problems are still unresolved and hindering their commercial applications: one is the fact of being lead-based and the other is the poor stability. Lead-free all-inorganic perovskite Cs3Bi2X9 (X = Cl</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec218AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The development of perovskite emitters, their use in light-emitting devices, and the challenges in enhancing the efficiency and stability, as well as reducing the potential toxicity of this technology are discussed in this Review.</p><p>Metal halide perovskites have shown promising optoelectronic properties suitable for light-emitting applications. recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0935-9648&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCED MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-220-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-220-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 30 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (9) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec220AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Nanostructured transition metal dichalcogenides (TMDs) are proven to be efficient and robust earth-abundant electrocatalysts to potentially replace precious platinum-based catalysts for the hydrogen evolution reaction (HER). However, the catalytic efficiency of reported TMD catalysts is still limited by their low-density active sites, low conductivity, and/or uncleaned surface. Herein, a genera</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0002-7863&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY" data-ta="Sidenav-221-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-221-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 140 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (30) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.9434-9443 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec221AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Photocatalysis may provide an intriguing approach to nitrogen fixation, which relies on the transfer of photoexcited electrons to the ultrastable N  N bond. Upon N-2 chemisorption at active sites (e.g., surface defects), the N-2 molecules have yet to receive energetic electrons toward efficient activation and dissociation, often forming a bottleneck. Herein, we report that the bottleneck can be</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-222-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-222-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 464 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7285) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.45-53 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec222AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Over the past several decades, <mark>quantum</mark> information science has emerged to seek answers to the question: can we gain some advantage by storing, transmitting and processing information encoded in systems that exhibit unique <mark>quantum</mark> properties? Today it is understood that the answer is yes, and many research groups around the world are working towards the highly ambitious technological goal of _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-224-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-224-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0036-8075&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=SCIENCE" data-ta="Sidenav-224-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-224-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 360 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (6396) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1442-1446 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec224AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The highest power conversion efficiencies (PCEs) reported for perovskite solar cells (PSCs) with inverted planar structures are still inferior to those of PSCs with regular structures, mainly because of lower open-circuit voltages (V-oc). Here we report a strategy to reduce nonradiative recombination for the inverted devices, based on a simple solution-processed secondary growth technique. This</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" Herein, poly (lactic-co-glycolic acid) (PLGA) loaded with black phosphorus <mark>quantum</mark> dots (BPQDs) is processed by an emulsion method to produce biodegradable </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1530-6984&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NANO LETTERS" data-ta="Sidenav-227-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-227-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 16 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (2) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1415-1420 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec227AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>High photoluminescence <mark>quantum</mark> yield, easily tuned emission colors, and high color purity of perovskite nanocrystals make this class of material attractive for light source or display applications. Here, green light-emitting devices (LEDs) were fabricated using inorganic cesium lead halide perovskite nanocrystals as emitters. By introducing a thin film of perfluorinated ionomer (PFI) sandwiched</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button The regulation produces the core/shell NPs with a single core and with different shell thicknesses, and it especially can be applied to different sizes Fe3O4 NPs and avoid the formation of core-free silica particles. Our results reveal that t</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1433-7851&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ANGEWANDTE CHEMIE-INTERNATIONAL EDITION" data-ta="Sidenav-229-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-229-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 57 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (20) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.5765-5771 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec229AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Graphite carbon nitride (g-C3N4) is a promising candidate for photocatalytic hydrogen production, but only shows moderate activity owing to sluggish photocarrier transfer and insufficient light absorption. Herein, carbon <mark>quantum</mark> dots (CQDs) implanted in the surface plane of g-C3N4 nanotubes were synthesized by thermal polymerization of freeze-dried urea and CQDs precursor. The CQD-implanted g-C</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" Thus far, graphene/h-BN heterostructures have been obtained only through a transfer process(1), which introduces structural uncertainties due to the random stacking between graphene and h-</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" Despite the recent surge of reports on microcrystalline, thin-film and bulk single-crystalline metal halides, very little is known about the photophysics of metal halides in the form of uniform, size-tunable nanocrystals. Here we report low-threshold amplified spont</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0926-3373&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=APPLIED CATALYSIS B-ENVIRONMENTAL" data-ta="Sidenav-232-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-232-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 221 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.47-55 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec232AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Exploring robust and low-cost noble-metal-free co-catalysts to substitute precious noble-metal is of great importance in both fundamental research and practical applications. Herein, we employ a novel solution-phase method to synthesize highly monodisperse zero-dimensional (0D) nickel phosphide (Ni2P) nanoparticles, which were then anchored on two-dimensional (2D) porous g-C3N4 nanosheets via a</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1748-3387&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE NANOTECHNOLOGY" data-ta="Sidenav-233-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-233-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 8 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (11) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.807-819 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec233AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Optical trapping and manipulation of micrometre-sized particles was first reported in 1970. Since then, it has been successfully implemented in two size ranges: the subnanometre scale, where light-matter mechanical coupling enables cooling of atoms, ions and molecules, and the micrometre scale, where the momentum transfer resulting from light scattering allows manipulation of microscopic object</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper This review presents a pedagogical account on topological insulator materials with an emphasis on basic theory and materials properties. _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-235-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-235-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0036-8075&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=SCIENCE" data-ta="Sidenav-235-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-235-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 336 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (6084) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1003-1007 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec235AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Majorana fermions are particles identical to their own antiparticles. They have been theoretically predicted to exist in topological superconductors. Here, we report electrical measurements on indium antimonide nanowires contacted with one normal (gold) and one superconducting (niobium titanium nitride) electrode. Gate voltages vary electron density and define a tunnel barrier between normal an</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0003-2654&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ANALYST" data-ta="Sidenav-236-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-236-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 140 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (2) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.386-406 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec236AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Surface plasmon resonance (SPR) has found extensive applications in chemi-sensors and biosensors. Plasmons play different roles in different types of optical sensors. SPR transduces a signal in a colorimetric sensor through shifts in the spectral position and intensity in response to external stimuli. SPR can also concentrate the incident electromagnetic field in a nanostructure, modulating flu</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0002-7863&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY" data-ta="Sidenav-237-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-237-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 128 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.2385-2393 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec237AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>By using bifunctional surface modifiers (SH-R-COOH), CdSe <mark>quantum</mark> dots (QDs) have been assembled onto mesoscopic TiO2 films. Upon visible light excitation, CdSe QDs inject electrons into TiO2 nanocrystallites. Femtosecond transient absorption as well as emission quenching experiments confirm the injection from the excited state of CdSe QDs into TiO2 nanoparticles. Electron transfer from the the</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0021-8979&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS" data-ta="Sidenav-238-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-238-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 86 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (1) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1-78 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec238AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The role of extended and point defects, and key impurities such as C, O, and H, on the electrical and optical properties of GaN is reviewed. Recent progress in the development of high reliability contacts, thermal processing, dry and wet etching techniques, implantation doping and isolation, and gate insulator technology is detailed. Finally, the performance of GaN-based electronic and photonic</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1674-7291&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=SCIENCE CHINA-CHEMISTRY" data-ta="Sidenav-239-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-239-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 61 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (12) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1503-1552 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec239AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Precise nanomedicine has been extensively explored for efficient cancer imaging and targeted cancer therapy, as evidenced by a few breakthroughs in their preclinical and clinical explorations. Here, we demonstrate the recent advances of intelligent cancer nanomedicine, and discuss the comprehensive understanding of their structure-function relationship for smart and efficient cancer Here, we propose to use graphene plasmons as a platform for strongly enhanced light-matter interactions. Specifically, we predict unprecedented high decay rates of qu</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button In the present study, the basic concepts and principles of photocatalytic water splitting have been discussed, and a guide for the selection of appropriate cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec242AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Nitrogen doping of carbon <mark>quantum</mark> dots results in improved fluorescence performance and a wider range of applications in photocatalysis, sensors, bioimaging, etc. Herein, a water-soluble and well-crystallized nitrogen-doped graphene <mark>quantum</mark> dot (N-GQD) has been obtained by using a MOF-derived carbon (ZIF-8C) as a new source of graphitic sheets. The preparation is based on a rapid, eco-friendly </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" However, as CDs are developed with increasing reports involved in producing many CDs, the structure and property features have changed enormously compared with the first generation of CDs, raising classification conc</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0950-6608&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=INTERNATIONAL MATERIALS REVIEWS" data-ta="Sidenav-245-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-245-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 48 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (1) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.45-66 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec245AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Efficient solid state energy conversion based on the Peltier effect for cooling and the Seebeck effect for power generation calls for materials with high electrical conductivity a, high Seebeck coefficient S, and low thermal conductivity k. Identifying materials with a high thermoelectric figure of merit Z(= S(2)sigma/k) has proven to be an extremely challenging task. After 30 years of slow pro</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-246-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-246-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1616-301X&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-246-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-246-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 25 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.998-1013 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec246AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Semiconductor photocatalysts have received much attention in recent years due to their great potentials for the development of renewable energy technologies, as well as for environmental protection and remediation. The effective harvesting of solar energy and suppression of charge carrier recombination are two key aspects in photocatalysis. The formation of heterostructured photocatalysts is a </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - Expand abstract for this record246">Show more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-247-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-247-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1614-6832&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCED ENERGY MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-247-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-247-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 9 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (8) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec247AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Scrupulous design and smart hybridization of bespoke electrode materials are of great importance for the advancement of sodium ion batteries (SIBs). Graphene-based nanocomposites are regarded as one of the most promising electrode materials for SIBs due to the outstanding physicochemical properties of graphene and positive synergetic effects between graphene and the introduced active phase. In </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-248-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-248-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 439 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7072) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.55-59 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec248AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Assembly of small building blocks such as atoms, molecules and nanoparticles into macroscopic structures - that is, 'bottom up' assembly - is a theme that runs through chemistry, biology and material science. Bacteria(1), macromolecules(2) and nanoparticles(3) can self-assemble, generating ordered structures with a precision that challenges current lithographic techniques. The assembly of nanop</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-rqc-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" kinetics is highly critical in determining the <mark>quantum</mark> efficiency of solar-to-chemical conversion in photocatalysis, and this includes, but is not limited to, the separation of photoexcited electron-hole pairs, utilization of plasmonic hot carriers and delivery of photo-induced charges to reaction sites, as well as activation of reactants by energized charges.
